meanings.definition: A person or thing that equalizes.
meanings.sent1: In the game, the referee acted as the equalisers to ensure fair play.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was the equalisers in the classroom, making sure everyone had the same opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The friendly robot claimed to be the equalisers in the group of toys, always mediating disputes.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence served as the equalisers in the chaotic household, bringing peace to all.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was known as the equalisers, always fighting for justice and equality.

meanings.definition: A device used to adjust or balance levels, as in audio equipment.
meanings.sent1: The sound engineer adjusted the equalisers on the mixer to get the perfect sound.
meanings.sent2: The equalisers on the stereo system helped to balance the bass and treble.
meanings.sent3: The magical equalisers in the music studio seemed to have a mind of their own, creating a symphony of sounds.
meanings.sent4: The equalisers on the amplifier worked like magic, enhancing the music to a whole new level.
meanings.sent5: With a twist of the equalisers, the music came alive, filling the room with vibrant melodies.
